title: Toddler killed after grandmother's gun goes off in bed, New Orleans police say
content:
A 3-year-old boy was fatally shot Wednesday morning (Jan. 20) while he was in bed sleeping with his grandmother, New Orleans police said. Authorities said he was shot by a gun under the pillow.
According to preliminary information from the New Orleans Police Department, the shooting happened shortly after 2 a.m. in the 5600 block of Red Maple Drive in the Michoud area. The 45-year-old grandmother, who works as a security guard, told police she was sleeping in bed with her grandson when her semi-automatic gun, which was under the pillow, fired.
"I can't imagine what they're going through at that house," said Betty McCormick.
The child was shot in the chest and rushed to the hospital, where authorities said he died. NOPD said the grandmother is being questioned and the investigation is ongoing. (UPDATE: Grandmother arrested, charged with negligent homicide)
NOPD Chief Michael Harrison told our news partners at WVUE Fox 8 that its homicide and child abuse units were part of the investigation. He did not say what caused the gun to fire.
